thread.title: Metrolink suspends trams in city centre after police van was involved in a collision
thread.title_full: Metrolink suspends trams in city centre after police van was involved in a collision

author: Sam Yarwood
title: Metrolink suspends trams in city centre after police van was involved in a collision
text:
Metrolink suspends trams in city centre after police van was involved in a collision It's understood two separate incidents have blocked the tracks Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Metrolink suspended trams in the city centre after a police van was involved in a collision. 
A spokesman for GMP confirmed they were called to the incident on Mosley Street at 9.30pm on Sunday. 
Officers were also dealing with another incident at Piccadilly Gardens, believed to be a man who had collapsed on the tracks. 
NWAS paramedic Darren Cabaniuk tweeted: “Next #Incident with @CFR_Altrincham a male in #PiccadillyGardens who fell on the @MCRMetrolink tracks - apologies for any delays.” 
Services on the City Zone line were suspended, with the East Didsbury, Altrincham, and Eccles via MediaCityUK lines also affected. All lines were reopened by 10.30pm, but passengers were warned of severe delays. 
Metrolink posted on its website: “Due to a police incident at Piccadilly Gardens, the City Zone line is currently suspended. Due to a Road Traffic Collision on Mosley street services from Piccadilly Gardens towards St Peters Square are suspended. Altrincham Services are turning at Deansgate Castlefield. 
“Eccles services turning at Deansgate Castlefield. Didsbury Services at Deansgate Castlefield.” Like us on Facebook
